description: Nikola Petrak discreetly delivers an encrypted simulation chip to key free zone organizers, urging them to collectively review its contents before any public action.
A free zone market merchant sells the simulation chip; community technologists quickly discover it depicts an alternative future for Stenograd based on inclusive governance after Halden's death.
Free zone councils organize open forums to debate the simulation's vision of cooperative leadership, drawing large crowds and igniting citywide discussion about genuine self-governance.
Directorate officials issue covert orders to confiscate simulation copies, calling them a threat to city order. Many free zone councils resist, secretly distributing the data further.

Inspired by the simulation, some free zones pilot shared leadership and transparent resource allocation. The Council becomes deeply divided: Directorate pushes for suppression, Innovators call for systemic reform, and citizens begin to openly question the Council’s legitimacy.
